result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Prusheik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Prescription Drug w/ Fraud [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 1/1/2016; alternate 5 days jail.

Court grants credit as TIME SERVED.
Concurrent with:

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Michael A Prusheik in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge.  State moves to strike the repeater allegation. Court imposed the following sentence:

30 days jail concurrent and given credit as time served.
Court costs of $243.00 to be paid at the rate of $25.00 a month commencing 01/01/2016 or alternate of 5 days jail.

Defendant Michael A Prusheik in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for plea and sentencing. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael A Prusheik in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense received discovery from the State and requests a another hearing in 30 days. Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness/Walgreens in Mukwonago listed in the Criminal Complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Michael A Prusheik in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
